Package controller

Class MainController

java.lang.Object
controller.MainController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MainController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Class controls main form window for inventory management system.

    • onActionDeletePart

      public void onActionDeletePart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Method deletes currently selected parts record. Confirmation message is displayed validating deletion.
      Parameters:
      event - take action on event

    • onActionDeleteProduct

      public void onActionDeleteProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Method deletes currently selected product record. Confirmation message is displayed validating deletion. If product contains associated parts warning message will be displayed indicating product may have associated parts.
      Parameters:
      event - take action on event

    • onActionPartsFilter

      public void onActionPartsFilter(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      RUNTIME ERROR - Method searches parts inventory based on entered text followed by pressing the return key. If entered text is a number record will display single record matching record ID. If entered text is a string a list of records will be displayed based on part names containing text. First record will be selected by default. Runtime error is corrected by testing integers first and catch all other entered text as string. If no matches are found label will be marked visible indicating no matches were found. This method is primarily for text copied in search field without utilization of pressing keyboard keys.
      Parameters:
      event - take action on event

    • onActionProductsFilter

      public void onActionProductsFilter(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      RUNTIME ERROR - Method searches products inventory based on entered text followed by pressing the return key. If entered text is a number record will display single record matching record ID. If entered text is a string a list of records will be displayed based on product names containing text. First record will be selected by default. Runtime error is corrected by testing integers first and catch all other entered text as string. If no matches are found label will be marked visible indicating no matches were found. This method is primarily for text copied in search field without utilization of pressing keyboard keys.
      Parameters:
      event - take action on event

    • onKeyReleasePartSearch

      public void onKeyReleasePartSearch(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      RUNTIME ERROR - Method searches parts inventory based on entered text while text field is populated. If entered text is a number record will display single record matching record ID. If entered text is a string a list of records will be displayed based on part names containing text. First record will be selected by default. Runtime error is corrected by testing integers first and catch all other entered text as string. If no matches are found label will be marked visible indicating no matches were found.
      Parameters:
      event - take action on event

    • onKeyReleaseProductSearch

      public void onKeyReleaseProductSearch(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      RUNTIME ERROR - Method searches products inventory based on entered text while text field is populated. If entered text is a number record will display single record matching record ID. If entered text is a string a list of records will be displayed based on product names containing text. First record will be selected by default. Runtime error is corrected by testing integers first and catch all other entered text as string. If no matches are found label will be marked visible indicating no matches were found.
      Parameters:
      event - take action on event

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Method initializes main form. Data is populated in parts table and products table based on all data available from inventory.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
